website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-GX8 offers a quick burst rate, in-body stabilization, and 4K video recording, making it a strong contender in the premium mirrorless camera space.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite camera going on 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I love the micro four thirds system for the smaller and lighter lenses (and thus more convenient and portable) compared to other systems. And this is by far my favorite camera body of any camera I've used, micro four thirds, film, APS-C or otherwise. It's unfortunate it didn't quite make it out in time to get the updated shutter mechanism, but on most lenses this isn't an issue, and the form factor, controls, and viewfinder are basically perfect. Even today, nearing 3 years after release, I can't identify a camera body I'd choose over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Psuedominimalist

customer_reviews.title: GX8 + Leica 8-18mm
customer_reviews.text: One of the best camera/lens combos ever w/8-18.. But w/the caveat you need to know what you're doing w/shutter speed since the ibis on the camera is useless with the Leica 8-18 and other non-Pana OIS stabilized lenses. But once you get to know the body with use and practice, it's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: A Fast, Flexible and Comprehensive photographic/video tool
customer_reviews.text: Blazing fast autofocus in S-AF... by far the fastest I have seen in a mirrorless camera. The body IS works well with Oly lenses, and the dual IS is extremely good with my testing (using the Panasonic 35-100 f2.8). The tilt EVF really opens up the ergonomics of the camera, especially combined with choosing focus points with the touchscreen. Video quality is top notch, even the 1080p is fantastic! If you are looking into m43's, I think this is the current best camera on offer when you add up all the features.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Fortunato

customer_reviews.title: Great camera if you go with USA model .
customer_reviews.text: If you get the US version, you will not be sorry. There is a 3 year extended warranty that the US models have plus you get 30 fps on the 4k recorder vs the international model which has that disabled.
customer_reviews.author: PVFocus

customer_reviews.title: This is the best (of course) so far
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several panasonic mirrorless cameras over the years. This is the best (of course) so far. the picture quality (due to dual image stabilization), fast response time (focus) is simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Puffercow

customer_reviews.title: Great MFT Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! Large, bright viewfinder. Still images are very high quality. Video quality is impressive and is particularly good for interview type shooting with proper lighting. Respectable low light still image performance. Good tactile feel - nice weight and balance. Handles well. Beautiful design - retro Rangefinder look - very attractive. Battery life not stellar - recommend getting several spares. Very customizable settings using hard controls and menu. Good enough for most pro work except perhaps high speed action; however the 4K still mode offers 8MP images @ 30fps, which with good lighting can capture impressive action shots.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Blue

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera in a beautiful design
customer_reviews.text: Long time DSLR user, switch to the m43 format and never looked back. Love everything about this camera, the menu/navigation is superior to Nikon and Canon, IQ is stunning, lens selection is top notch. This thing is jam-packed with features. Auto focus is a dream, burst mode and 4K photo are awesome. Wifi works extremely well and always comes in handy. I guess the overall size of the camera could have been a bit smaller, but personally I think it's perfect. Of your considering this camera, I would HIGHLY recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cuesta

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic GX8 is a Winner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ergonomics, EVF, and image quality. With the 15mm/F1.7 it reminds me of the Leica M6. Handles wonderfully on the streets. B&W .jpegs are very good straight out of the camera. Get the larger DMW EC-3 Lumix eyecup. Its much better in the bright sun and is made of a soft material.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rigas

customer_reviews.title: GX 8 a great camera for stills not enough features for videographers.
customer_reviews.text: It is a fantastic camera,weatherproof fast focus,build quality all rate A plus.I bought this primarily for backup camera to use with my Atomos Shogun but as Panasonic Experts told me.This camera is primarily made for stills.When Camer HDMI cable is hooked up to an external monitor it works fine until you press record on camera then you loose video.Also was perplexed why this camera that can shoot 4K video has no headphone jack.After a few years with Gh4 I got spoiled with its many video features. Love V Log and slomo on Gh4.Gx 8 does not have these features. Gx 8 optical viewfinder is fantastic. I will really miss that.
customer_reviews.author: Craig B.

customer_reviews.title: Super camera. Lots of features to get used to
customer_reviews.text: Super camera. Lots of features to get used to. Takes a bit of time but well worth it. My number 1 not pocket camera.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, but with the 14-140 lens, not as sharp as I had hoped, returned.
customer_reviews.author: d tolin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera!!!! Worth the investment in the body and lenses.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. As a long time Panasonic camera user (also have a Canon 5D), this is an amazing upgrade to the GX line. I use the camera for underwater images and for macro, I know of no better system. As I tend to use them till they wear out (shutter mostly), I will be buying more.

customer_reviews.text: Reading some of negative reviews I can only assume these people know little or nothing about cameras or photography, one review says image quality is, I suspect that's down to the user not the camera,this takes superb pictures and is feature packed camera the menu is easy to navigate if you know it all means which is user knowledge not the camera, the image stabilisation a great feature when using Olympus lenses. This is the best Panasonic camera to date

customer_reviews.title: Camera shakes with LENS OIS ON + BODY IS ON + ELECTRONIC SHUTTER / SILENT SHUTTER ON.
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera a lot coming from GX7 but the Camera shakes with LENS OIS ON + BODY IS ON + ELECTRONIC SHUTTER / SILENT SHUTTER ON. I don't experience the shake if LENS OIS is turned OFF. I'm using the Lumix 12-35mm f2.8 lens.

customer_reviews.text: Please be aware that Panasonic does not plan to support all of its Lumix G lenses for use with the dual stabilization on this camera. In particular according to[...] "Lenses that will NOT be support Dual IS : 14-45mm f/3.5-5.6 45-200mm f/4.0-5.6 100-300mm f/4.0-5.6" I for one plan to find a new camera manufacturer.
